{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31521].
  {panel}

Reproducible in JIRA 5.2.4 but not reproducible in JIRA 4.4.5


Steps to reproducible:
# create a select list with multiple Context. refer to Configuration.png
# create same name value for some of the context. Eg: "sun" exist in multiple context
# create issues with the value "sun" for issue in different project that use different custom field context
# create a new dashboard
# add a new Issue Statistic Gadget. Sort by Total as per shown in EditGadget.png
# Issue Statistic gadget will have multiple "sun" that has same total issue:
!Problem.png!

(i) This is not reproducible if the Sort By is set to Natural
fields.summary: Issue Statistic Gadget Shows Wrong Data When Sort By Total
Project Message Board
Include Last Modified By in Issue Navigator Columns

As a user, I want to change the issue type from different workflows
Permission to edit remaining estimate of an issue
When JIRA starts up or is set up it should check the database encoding and prevent running if the encoding is not acceptable
Support Custom Events with WebHooks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31507].
  {panel}

A very nice feature would have either

1) When you start typing a bug title in the "Summary" text box, it starts listing similar names that might match, to prevent writing duplicates issues.  Possibly include a link for those titles that could open in a new page/tab for them to have a quick view in case they find one that may match.

or

2) Have it go to to a verification page after submitting the report, listing similar summary titles based and/or descriptions matching the correct report in progress, giving you the ability to verify first before final submission.

The reason I request this feature is because if you do not have the proper privileges, you cannot just delete duplicates. It would help prevent duplicates, giving both yourself, and your administrator less work on having to delete the duplicates.
fields.summary: Instant Search or Verification check for duplicates

fields.description:
objectconfiguration_form.jsp uses in SELECT type the ObjectConfiguration.getFieldValuesHtmlEncoded() does not support Values with "Null" Option.

If a ValueGenerator provides values with "null" as key, a NullPointerException occurs.

With ObjectConfiguration.getFieldValues() in previous version (since 3.x), it was working correctly.

Usage of Null as key is done for None value, when "-1" is not usable.
fields.summary: Implementation of getFieldValuesHtmlEncoded in ObjectConfiguration does not support "null" in values

fields.description:
When we use the [search|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/5.2.5/#id333082] call in REST API, and try to expand the _transitions_, nothing appears in the transition part.

As a workaround, if I need the transitions, I need to use the [transitions|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/5.2.5/#id326996] call instead, but the difference is that I need to specify the issue ID to do that while in the _search_ call I can just specify the project.
fields.summary: Transitions are not appearing in the SEARCH call on Rest API
Convert the attachments links created from emails in the body of the issues to working links opening the attachments directly
As a Resource Manager I'd like to be able to filter the Activity Stream Gadget by Sprint
Semantic issue-linking from within from wiki-fields
Archiving comments
Sorting of username (displayName) according to pattern "Lastname, Firstname"

fields.description:
h3. Summary of bug

If a user re-orders his/her favorite dashboards, after re-ordering, the user is unable to configure the dashboards anymore (the cog at the right side of each of the dashboards). When the cogs are clicked, nothing happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a few new dashboards
# Click on the 'Dashboards' dropdown menu, and click on 'Manage Dashboards'
# At the 'Favorite Dashboards' tab, re-order some of the dashboards there
# After re-ordering, try to click on the cogs at the right side

h3. Additional Info

* Sometimes, after re-ordering, when the cog is clicked, the dropdown menu will flash and disappear. After that, when the cog is clicked again, it will show as usual
* However, most of the time, nothing happens when it is clicked

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page after moving an item
fields.summary: Unable to configure favorite dashboards after re-ordering

fields.description:
We have a slight but very annoying problem when using the Finnish translations in JIRA.

We use Tempo for time tracking, and with Tempo everything works as illustrated in the attached JIRA translation issue 1.png. When using Tempo's date popup it brings the value as "31/tammi/13"

However, when we are creating or editing an issue, and choosing the due date ("Valmistusmispvm" in finnish), as illustrated in the attached JIRA translation issue 2.jpg  from the default issue create or edit screen, the Date popup brings the value as e.g. "31/Tammi/13"

This brings an error as JIRA don't accept tammi (January) starting with the capital letter T. We can however edit the string 31/Tammi/13 manually to 31/tammi/13 and it works.

In finnish it's not supposed to be in capital, and now it is really annoying to change it manually every time we are creating or editing the due date of an issue.

So it seems that JIRA's default date popup still validates this according to english rules but Tempo's date popup brings the value right for some strange reason. 

Tempo is not translated to Finnish, so We're a little bit confused why the date transfers in the right form from the popup in Tempo's date popup, but doesn't transfer in the right format from the default date popup in JIRA's create/edit screen. 

Could this be solved by editing JIRA's advanced date settings? If so, what would be the right configuration?

If not, what to do to get rid of this little but very annoying annoyance?
fields.summary: Problem with JIRA's default calendar due date popup from where to choose the date

fields.description:
From JRA-27353

Steps to reproduce:

1. install JIRA
2. setup LDAP directory - create test data (see below)
3. add LDAP directory in JIRA configuration with option "Enable Nested Groups" enabled
4. synchronize data
5. change name of "sub_group" to "Sub_group" and update uniqueMember parameter of parent_group to match changed name
6. synchronize data again - here crowd should fail on inserting data into database (CWD_MEMBERSHIP table)

I was able to reproduce it with HSQL and PostgreSQL.

Test data - two groups with relation:

    parent_group, uniqueMember= {sub_group}
    sub_group

LDIF export of my test data (I've configured LDAP to use root entity dc=atlassian,dc=pl):
parent_group.ldif

version: 1

dn: cn=parent_group,dc=atlassian,dc=pl
objectClass: groupOfUniqueNames
cn: parent_group
uniqueMember: cn=sub_group,dc=atlassian,dc=pl
description: Parent group

sub_group.ldif

version: 1

dn: cn=sub_group,dc=atlassian,dc=pl
objectClass: groupOfUniqueNames
cn: sub_group
uniqueMember: 
description: Child group

Also to see effect of exception which you should get in step 6 you may add user and set membership using uniqueMember attribute - this user won't be added to any group because of synchronization fail (user should be created, groups also, but no user membership in group will be created).
fields.summary: Directory synchronisation fails when the name of a nested group changes in case
Return issue url in REST api (JQL endpoint)
Need option to export query data as TSV and/or CSV
Update docs for <= JQL function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31487].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a blocking issue is resolved, all blocked issues should get notified of the change, so that people watching those issues can respond.


h3. Suggested Solution
There is no way to perform this natively in JIRA.
 
h3. Workaround 
The third party add-on [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview] (paid) provides a post-function for that: *Update blocking issues* ([source|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/builtin-scripts.html#_post_functions])
fields.summary: Notify blocked issues when blocker resolved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31486].
  {panel}

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-726

How to reproduce:
- try to import a big dump of e.g. Trac and set websudo timeout to 1 minute. If the upload and initial scan takes more time than websudo timeout, you will spot this problem.

See also https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=295308267
fields.summary: When the upload (for file-based importers) or the initial structure analysis takes too long, then due to additional websudo check (which breaks JIM) continuing importing is not possible

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-784 - see original issue for more information

As per the subject.

Steps to reproduce:

- Using Internet Explorer 8, go to the CSV importer;
- Select a valid CSV file to import;

Current behavior:
- The file doesn't seems to be loaded. You need to select the file many times to the importer load the CSV file. Sometimes it works, many times not (attachment "error-csv1.png").


Expected behavior:
- The file must be loaded.

Proceeding, when the file loads, you need to choose a project to import the CSV file. It fails again when choosing a project, and you need to select the target project many times. Finally, when you were able to select a target project, the "JIRA Field" is being cut on the 9th character:

(attachment "error-csv2.png")

Thanks in advance,
Lucas Timm

  {panel}

When using CSV importer on Custom Field Label, the CSV is not importing Custom Field of *Label* type correctly. 

Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-888 - see original issue for more details

+Step to reproduce+
# Create CSV files with multiple labels by entering each label in a separate column.
# Import as usual by specifying the column with Custom Field Label.
# Import Successful.
# *ONLY* the first value was imported in Custom Field Label.

+Expected Behavior+
*All* the value in the column configure should import and form multiple value for Custom Field Label.
\\
h4. This does not happen with *System Field* of Labels

fields.description: On the Create Issue Screen (default) all the fields are gone. It only appears the project and the Issue Type. The fields configuration it seems to be OK. It's the default one.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31480].
  {panel}

It appears that the Description field size is limited in Create Issue in Dialog Box and Edit In Line.

Ours tests show that as soon as the Description fields exceed a size between 1700 Kb and 2000 Kb, the submission of the action fails with "XSRF Security Token Missing".

Using the default old action (*Create Issue* link using the scroll wheel click under Windows or using direct access to http://hostName/jira/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa), we have successfully created description with a size of 8Mb.

Vincent
fields.summary: Create Issue (Dialog Box and In Line) with large text in description fails with "XSRF Security Token Missing"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31464].
  {panel}

When sending mail to JIRA with ccassignee on, either the CC field or the second recipient (in the TO field) is made the assignee. If this user does not have assignable features, something else will happen, but this is not logged. For scenarios where there are multiple users with the same email address and one is assignable and one is not, we need the error to specify the user_name attribute for comparison.

Steps to reproduce:

# Install JIRA
# Create two users with the same email address
# Make one user assignable
# Configure handler/mail server
# Send email to JIRA cc assignee
# Confirm that no warning is in log
# Confirm that the created ticket is not assigned to CC
fields.summary: When ccassignee is not an Assignable user, no error is logged

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

Using the new Issue Navigator, when using a date field (Created Date, Due Date, etc), it would face some problems when using Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Use Firefox to access a JIRA 5.2 (or 5.2.x) instance
# In the Issue Navigator, add a criteria that uses date (for this example, let's use Created Date)
# Open created date filter and select first radio option (Created within last) and try to enter number in the text box.
#* It doesn't let you select the text box unless you click twice within the text box.
# Try to select the time (minutes, days, hours, weeks) from the drop down next to the text box. 
#* Drop down doesn't stay open and you have to hold the mouse and drag to the correct option to select

h3. Additional findings

* This behavior is unable to be reproduced in Google Chrome
fields.summary: Issue Navigator experiences some problems when using Firefox

fields.description:
If custom events are created, during custom event firing, the WebHooks code (EventTypeInfoDecorator) doesn't seem to get mapped with the custom event and throws a NPE, its local map contains only:

{noformat}
{1=jira:issue_created, 8=jira:issue_deleted, 3=jira:issue_updated, 5=jira:issue_updated, 7=jira:issue_updated, 4=jira:issue_updated, 14=jira:issue_updated, 6=jira:issue_updated, 9=jira:issue_updated, 2=jira:issue_updated, 11=jira:issue_updated, 12=jira:issue_updated, 13=jira:issue_updated, 15=jira:worklog_updated, 16=jira:worklog_updated, 10=jira:worklog_updated}
{noformat}

There is no mention of custom events that have been created in JIRA, hence NPE.  The behaviour isn't affected by a JIRA restart.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31457].
  {panel}

Customer is receiving this message in the Issue Collector configuration page: 

"Issue Collectors will not record all the data submitted in the form, since the description and environment fields for the issue type are not present.
Field presence can be set up on Fields page."

It is confusing because in this case, only the environment field was not present.  When the customer goes to fix this, they would likely start with trying to figure out how to show the description field first, which would ultimately confuse them.  

It's also not blatantly clear that the system is telling you to enable the description and environment fields.  It is worded in a way that it leads the customer to think that they need to add additional unknown fields.  Maybe 'description and environment fields' needs to be bolded?
fields.summary: Unclear Issue Collector message - vague and also tells the customer they need to enable a field which they do not.

fields.description:
When configured a _Cascading Select_ field prevents users from being able to create *any* new issue. See the following examples:

Scenario 1 {color:red}works fine{color}:
* Cascading Select field set to _*Any Issue Type*_
* No default value is set
* The field is *not* attached to any screen

Scenario 2 {color:red}breaks everything{color} (no new issues can be created, regardless of type, project, user, etc.):
* Cascading Select field set to _*Any Issue Type*_
* Default value set to *None*
* The field is *not* attached to any screen

Scenario 3 {color:red}doesn't works fine{color}: (affect user's ability to create most tickets, but it does prevent them from being able to create a ticket with the specific issue type that was chosen within the configuration scheme)
* Cascading Select field set to *some specific issuetype*
* Default value set to *None*
* The field is *not* attached to any screen

Scenario 4 {color:red}breaks everything{color} (no new issues can be created, regardless of type, project, user, etc.):
* Cascading Select field set to _*Any Issue Type*_
* Default value set to *None*
* The field is attached to *some* screen (any screen)

Scenario 5 {color:red}works fine{color}:
* Cascading Select field set to *some specific issuetype*
* Default value set to *None*
* The field is attached to *some* screen (any screen)

Scenario 6 {color:red}works fine{color}:
* Cascading Select field set to _*Any Issue Type*_

fields.description:
In JIRA versions 5.2+, JIRA attempts to create the following directories:
*<jira-installation>/conf/Catalina/localhost/*
However, this folder is empty and it is not used. In Linux installations, the *conf* folder is read-only and this prevents JIRA from starting up as it attempts to create the Catalina/localhost in that folder. 

The correct folder location should be: 
*<jira-installation>/work/Catalina/localhost/*

Seems to occur only in 5.2 and above. Tested with JIRA 5.2.3 and JIRA 5.2.4.
fields.summary: JIRA creates directory conf/Catalina/localhost which is empty, and JIRA fails to start if conf directory is read-only

fields.description:
When a new team of developers or testers comes into a project we need to add a long list of Jira users to a project role.
After entering 30+ names, if there is an error with a single one (already in the list) instead of adding the remaining users it fails the whole group AND it wipes out names entered.
A user already in the list is clearly not grounds to fail the entire group entry and, even if it did post a notice of duplicate, other names should be added OR entry field should NOT be cleared.  Our only alternative is to enter one at a time which is very time-consuming to compensate for this user-unfriendly design.
fields.summary: Error on one of many users being added to Jira project role fails to add any and wipes out all data entry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31435].
  {panel}

Current method requires:

1. Something requires mail to be stopped. This can be a mail loop, a dev server accessing the wrong email, etc.
2. JIRA server shut down
3. Add jvm email disable params
4. Start JIRA server back up
5. Troubleshoot issue
6. Shut JIRA down
7. Remove jvm params
8. Start JIRA back up.

Steps 2 and 6 result in loss of email in the queue. Restarting JIRA twice will waste 5-10 mins on shutdown startup time. While this is not a super high priority, it is an improvement which would be really nice to have when you are suffering from serious mail issues.

The current method also requires filesystem level access to the instance. A JIRA sysadmin may not have this level of access depending on org structure. This results in them having to bring in secondary administrators which further delays the time to act.
fields.summary: Add incoming mail shutoff button within the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31434].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Install 2x JIRA(tested on 5.2.3) with JIRA Charting plugin 1.10
# Create test project in first JIRA instance(source)
# Create custom field of type 'Time in Status'
# Export XML backup
# Initialize Project Import in second JIRA instance(destination).

h3. Expected Results:
Project import completes successfully. Our documentation states: "All the target JIRA system custom fields and the custom fields included in JIRA plugins supported by Atlassian (e.g. JIRA Toolkit, Charting Plugin, Labels Plugin, Perforce Plugin) are compatible with the Project Import tool."
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Restoring+a+Project+from+Backup

h3. Actual results:
Project import fails with error 'Unable to import custom field 'Time in Status'. The custom field type does not support project imports.'

h3. Workaround:
Remove any reference to the custom field in the XML backup by following these steps:
- Unzip archive and search for the string 'charting'
- Remove custom field entry in the entities.xml file:
{code}
<CustomField id="10000" customfieldtypekey="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:timeinstatus" customfieldsearcherkey="com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting:textsearcher" name="Time in Status"/>
{code}
fields.summary: Project Import tool not compatible with JIRA Charting plugin custom field 'Time in Status'

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31428].
  {panel}

We are experiencing some constraint with JIRA Restore procedure ...

In our database schema (ORACLE), we have defined a Read Only account dedicated to reporting done by BIRT. (GRANT SELECT ANY TABLE TO RO_ACCOUNT).

This configuration has been done on all env. (Prod, QA, Test, Dev.).

When restore of JIRA is done through XML, it appears that the Import procedure performs a delete/insert (with alter table in case of upgrade). It works correctly for us.

But the import of AO tables performs drop/create/insert, and the side effect is that the SELECT privilege is lost by the Read Only account.
I have again to check others added object (View, Stored Procedure) ...

Minimal wanted improvement : Documentation about such risk, some alert during the import procedure, ......

I think that it would be hard to see the AO import modified.

Thanks
Vincent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31422].
  {panel}

Making Required a Cascading Select field, the validation should control all levels of the field as soon as the selected Parent option has Child options.

It should be the default behaviour !
	
Other behaviours, detailed in JRA-10302 are improvement ...
* Be able to have some Parent option where the Child selection is mandatory
* Be able to have other Parent option where the Child selection is optional
	
My current use case is to see a Cascading Select mandatory (all existing levels) when entered from UI (in Create Transiton) and optional when created by a Mail Handler.
* Using the native Required option where only the 1st level is mandatory, we obtain an unwanted behviour for creation done from UI, and it lets the Mail Handler create the issue with the field not entered (as we want).
* Using the workaround based on Jira Workflows Toolbox plugin, we can make the 2 Levels mandatory with the Validator : Correct for UI. The Required option is not needed here. But it blocks the creation by Mail Handler. 

V.
fields.summary: Cascading Select should be consistent related the Required option

But he validates the forms directly, on server side, the date is converted in dd/mm/00yy. 1/1/13 gives 01 Jan. 0013.

It would be useful to have the same behaviour on both side.

I tried a workaround using ALS and performing the JS conversion (Date.parseDate method) on Blur and KeyPress (key=13) events, but I have not success to identify correclty Date and DateTime Pickers.

V.
fields.summary: Date Picker has not the same conversion in Java and Javascript

fields.description:
If you write your own CustomFieldSearcher and you would like to inject your own dependencies (components) to the constructor you will get UnsatisfiableDependenciesException.
Additionally CustomFieldSearcher implementation class (provided by a plugin) is instantiated by JIRA in a different way while adding a custom field from admin UI and in a different way when the searcher is actually used.
In one case the injection will work, but not in the other.

The only workaround known to me at that time is to:
- define you dependency as a public module (public to OSGi) in your plugin
- do NOT attempt to inject it to your CustomFieldSearcher implementation constructor
- instead in init(CustomField) method use ComponentAccessor.getOSGiComponentInstanceOfType(YourDependencyClass.class) and assign it to a field for future use.

Obviously it should be fixed in JIRA core so that normal injections (of local modules) work fine.
fields.summary: Component injection does not work correctly for own implementation of customfield-searcher module type

Hi,

We are a Java development company and we are using Tempo (via Jira) since a few years now. Since a few month, a signicative part of the development team moved (physically) to a customer house (as consultants).

At this company, we convinced them to use Jira and Tempo :-) So, they have bought Jira and Tempo and now, they are asking internal and consultant to encode the hours in their own Tempo.

We have now a mix system where : 
* employees working fully internally are encoding hours on our own Tempo 
* employees working fully externally are encoding jours on customer Tempo 
* employees working partly internally and externally are encoding in both Tempo the hours.

We would like to have a consolidated view on our internal developers (via Tempo) without asking the developers to encode both time (external and internal Tempo) the hours. We have seen that there is a possibility to use the import/export external hours but we would like to have your advice on this topics.

Thanks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-31397].
  {panel}

If the size of the screen that is being used to access JIRA is small, it is possible that the 'More Actions' dropdown menu is not shown properly, or the user is unable to view the entire menu.

Note : This only happens in IE8, but not in Firefox.

Also, if the user uses a bigger screen, then the menu can be seen properly. (The tests where the dropdown menu is not able to be seen properly was done on a laptop, while if the user uses a desktop, it is shown fine)

This is shown in the following screenshots :

* The behavior in IE8 :

!IE8 (1).png|thumbnail!

* The behavior in Firefox :

!Mozilla.png|thumbnail!

* The behavior in a desktop :

!more actions desktop.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'More Actions' dropdown not shown properly if screen is small
